page.title: 12THRUXTON AIRFIELD & CIRCUIT.
page.content: Over half of Thruxton Airfield is in our area, including three of the four runways. Aeroplanes from Thruxton Flight Centre may be seen taking off together with gliders of the Inkpen Gliding Club & members of the Thruxton Parachute Club. Around the airfield runs the Thruxton Circuit used for testing and racing cars and motorcycles, demonstration and promotion purposes and also fund- raising runs. There are twelve race meetings a year, nine for racing-cars and three for motorcycles and T.V. cameras are often on the scene. The eastern end of the airfield is a mini-industrial estate. Among the many industries are metal-working and engineering, the making of traffic- lights, flying jackets, binoculars, model aircraft and wine-cooling trays.
